intro: Tarrietia erythrosiphon var. alluaudiana, commonly known as the red-tipped tarrietia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red-tipped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Native to parts of tropical Africa, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and shaded landscapes.
